post.body: This is pretty awesome. The Zerobit team has done a great job. Who is doing UX/Design for these webapps? They are fantastic!
Need a privacy/freedom-respecting/preloaded with Linux computer: check out System76 - https://system76.com
Seems to be a lot of my Linux brothers and sisters on ZeroNet. Curious as to what the ratio of operating systems in here... :)

Anyone looking for an excellent laptop to use w/ ZeroNet should check out the Oryx Pro. Ars Technica says about it: "Linux in a laptop has never been better" http://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2016/11/system76-oryx-pro-review-linux-in-a-laptop-has-never-been-better/
Pretty cool article with awesome alternatives for creating content on Linux! http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/7-apps-prove-dont-need-adobe-creative-suite-linux/
Recently guest wrote an article about improving HiDPI under Ubuntu on the Ubuntu Developer Blog! Check it out: https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/blog/2016/12/05/improving-hidpi-support/
Hey folks, I've started doing Community Management for the ZeroNet Project. How would you best prefer to get updates on ZeroNet?

comment.body: @Timaris Lintz: sure thing, just a sec.
@Humblebeaver: Hey there, nice to see you in here!
@9yqze: or machine learning, or movie editing, or 3D animation. :)
